author: DJ2studios

text: @mujzupanek The problem with this is Sega doesn't seem to have the same design talent it had in the 90's. Back then, there was real competition between first and third party developers and the consoles they programmed for. Nearly everything is cross-platform now, and since Sega doesn't their own system to promote, they seem to have lost what made them great to begin with.

author: arjan snijder

text:
(posted by ICYTR's Husband who's been to date too lazy to setup his own youtube account and is kyping hers) :-)

This is a great track! Lots of memories for me. I was 15 when the Saturn hit the US, 16 or 17 when I played this, and loved the music! Very nice symphonics, great way musically to start a (for the time) -epic- adventure. My only thing about this (and this is -not- a slam, I rather like it) is that it has a slightly "70's TV series" tinge to it. Listen for it and see if you hear it!
author: ICYTR

author: Boyce18

text:
So you can play Panzer Dragoon on PS2, PC and Xbox (with Panzer Dragoon Orta, wich is the last installment of the series by now and is considered one of the best games for the first Xbox), whatever you like)))
Zwei and Saga, however, remain Saturn exclusives, but you can play using an emulator. I played PD Saga and it run with no problems, however, I played only the first levels, I don't know if there will be bugs further in the game, check the compatibility list to be sure))
